Name: manuredeletewarning
Text: This manure/compost has been added to one or more fields. Deleting it will remove this manure/compost from those field(s).

Name: welcome
Text:
This is an archived message: How Farmers and Consultants are using the Nutrient Management Calculator

  • Estimate nutrient requirements for crops
  • Compare your manure and fertilizer applications with crop nutrient needs
  • Enter and download information confidentially
  • Create pdf reports for farm use

This is a beta version that is being tested by farmers and consultants before its release in March 2018.

Name: disclaimer
Text:
All information contained within the Nutrient Management Calculator is provided solely "as is" at the user's own risk. Although every effort has been made to ensure that the information contained in the Nutrient Management Calculator is accurate, the Government of British Columbia assumes no legal liability or responsibility for the completeness, accuracy, or usefulness of the information provided or any product resulting from the use of the Nutrient Management Calculator.

Information requested by this website, such as farm name and field names, is not collected or saved anywhere except on your computer.

Name: agriinfomessage
Text:
Agronomic Balance

  • agronomic balances mainly indicate if crop nutrient requirements are met
  • crop removal balances can indicate if soil phosphorus (P) or potassium (K) levels will change

Learn more (opens in new tab)

Name: cropinfomessage
Text:
Crop Removal Balance

  • Crop removal balances indicate if soil phosphorus (P) or potassium (K) levels will change
  • Agronomic balances mainly indicate if crop nutrient requirements are met
  • Increases in soil P in the long term are a possible water quality concern

Learn more (opens in new tab)

Name: fileoverwritewarning
Text: Download file to save the changes you made, or Continue without saving.

Name: finishwithoutsaving
Text: Download a file to save the changes you made, or Continue to close this session without saving.

Text: e.g., poor drainage in southwest corner (no need to specify crop here)

Text: Previous crop ploughed down (N credit)

Name: soiltestwarning
Text:
Do you have soil tests from within the past 3 years?

  • No - Click Next

Name: moreinfo
Text: Learn more (opens in new tab)

Name: soiltest
Text:
Lab (Soil Test Methods)

  • Different labs use different soil test methods for phosphorus (P) and potassium (K)
  • Different methods give different values for the same soil sample
  • This website converts lab report values to standard ('Kelowna' method-equivalent) values
  • Lab not listed? Click Learn more below

Learn more (opens in new tab)

Name: invaliddevice
Text: Use another device for best performance. This site has not been designed for iPhones or iPads.

Name: defaultsoiltest
Text:
For fields without a soil test, very high soil P and K fertility and a pH of 6.0 will be assumed.

Crop P and K requirements will be 0 on fields without a soil test.

Name: missingregion
Text: Before adding a field, you must specify a region under Farm Information.

Name: othernutrientplaceholder
Text: e.g. irrigation water

Name: deletewarningmanuregenerated
Text: This deletes the manuregenerated/obtained details.

Name: storagesystemnamedefault
Text: {0} Storage System {1}

Name: storagestructureliquidnameplaceholder
Text: e.g. under-barn, or steel tank

Name: storagestructuresolidnameplaceholder
Text: e.g. concrete walled

Name: explainmaterialsneedingstorage
Text: These are the manure types, composts, etc. that should be stored but haven't been assigned to a storage system yet.

Name: ImportMaterialIsMaterialAppliedQuestion
Text: Is the material stored?

Name: remainingMaterialsMessage
Text: The following materials are not applied to a field

Name: overUtilizedMaterialsMessage
Text: There is not enough of the following materials to meet the planned application rates

Name: materialsNotStoredMessage
Text: The following materials are not stored

Name: NoMaterialsForStorage
Text: There are no materials of this type to store. To add materials, go back to add animals or add imported material.

Name: ExplainWashWaterTypes
Text: Enter total wash water volumes added daily.Typical wash water volumes range from 5 to 10 US gallons/day/cow.

Name: FileLoadQuestion
Text: Do you have a file to load?

Name: ExplainFileLoad
Text: An ".nmp file" is the only place to save or store information that you will be asked to provide.You can load an .nmp file from your computer to continue work that has been started.

Name: nutrientAnalysisForMaterialsMessage
Text: Add a nutrient Analysis for each of these storage systems or imported materials, if you intend to use the materials to grow crops or amend soil.

Name: DeviceTooSmallMessage
Text: Use another device for best performance as this site requires a screen minimum width of 768 pixels

Name: MaterialsOctoberToMarchMessage
Text: The total volume of manure generated from October to March

Name: RunoffOctoberToMarchMessage
Text: The volume of yard and roof runoff water entering the storage system from October to March

Name: MaterialsStoredOctoberToMarchMessage
Text: The total volume of liquid manure that is stored from October to March

Name: PrecipitationOctoberToMarch
Text: The total volume of manure, yard and roof runoff, and precipitation added to an uncovered storage structure from October to March

Name: RegionRequiredWarning
Text: A region must be selected so that the nutrient management calculator can provide accurate estimates for climate and crop requirements

Name: StorageDeficiencyMessage
Text: Materials to be stored is more than the Storage Volume

Name: NutrientAnalysisMoistureMessage
Text: This value should be a percentage of the moisture contained in the material as received.  It should not be a dry matter value

Name: NutrientAnlalysisNitrogenMessage
Text: This value is the percentage of the manure/compost made up of total nitrogen (TN), which includes the organic and inorganic portions

Name: NutrientAnlalysisAmmoniaMessage
Text: This value is the portion of the manure/compost in the form of ammonium-nitrogen (NH4-N), an inorganic/mineral form of nitrogen. It may also be expressed in units of mg/kg or mg/L

Name: NutrientAnlalysisPhosphorousMessage
Text: This value is the percentage of the manure/compost made up of phosphorus (P)

Name: NutrientAnlalysisPotassiumMessage
Text: This value is the percentage of the manure compost made up potassium (K).

Name: CalculateNutrientsPrevManureMessage
Text: A significant factor in the amount of potentially mineralized nitrogen is the history of manure application. Mineralization of organic matter from previous years' manure applications may be different from the given value depending on manure application frequency, rate, and farm location

Name: CalculateOtherNutrientSourceMessage
Text: Enter a description of the nutrient source

Name: CalculateOtherNutrientAvailableThisYearMessage
Text: These values represent the amount of nutrients available to the crop from the nutrient source during the growing season.  These will be added to the Agronomic Balance.

Name: CalculateOtherNutrientAvailbleLongTermMessage
Text: These values represent the amount of nutrients added to the soil from the nutrient source.  These will be added to the Crop Removal Balance.

Name: FarmDataBackwardsCompatibility
Text: Warning: The loaded file is from a previous version of the Nutrient Management Calculator. If your file contained manure data, assign a source to each type of manure to avoid errors in the calculation and reporting functions.

Name: CalculateNutrientsNitrogenNitrateMessage
Text: By default, this value calculates the nitrate available in the top 6" of soil at the time the soil sample was taken.  In the South Coast where nitrate is leached overwinter, this value will be zero if the sample was taken before spring.

Name: SoilTestValuesMessage
Text: Do not enter results from soil samples taken deeper than 6 inches (15cm).Do not use post-harvest nitrate tests results here

Name: SoilTestNitrogenNitrateMessage
Text: The amount of nitrogen available in the form of nitrate (NO3-N), and is generally expressed in ppm or mg/kg. Found on a recent soil test report.

Name: SoilTestPhosphorousMessage
Text: The amount of available phosphorus given from a recent soil test. Generally expressed in ppm or mg/kg.

Name: SoilTestPotassiumMessage
Text: The amount of available potassium given from a recent soil test. Generally expressed in ppm or mg/kg.

Name: SoilTestPHMessage
Text: Soil pH is the measure of a soil's acidity or alkalinity. Ranges between 4 and 9 in most soils.

Name: PercentageLiquidVolumeSeparatedMessage
Text: Percentage of liquid volume separated into a solid manure.

Name: AmmoniumRetensionMessage
Text: This value is an estimate of how much volatile ammoniums is retained in the manure after application.  Manure type, and the timing and method of application affect retention.

Name: AvailableOrganicNitrogenMessage
Text: This value is an estimate of how much of the stable organic nitrogen in manure will become available during the growing season.

Name: AvailableNutrientsThisYearMessage
Text: These values represent the estimated amount of nutrients available to the crop during the growing season from the manure at the calculated application rate.  These will be added to the Agronomic Balance.

Name: AvaiableNutreintsLongTermMessage
Text: These values represent the estimated amount nutrients added to the soil from the manure at the calculated application rate.  These will be added to the Crop Removal Balance.

Name: NoManureSourceAddedWarning
Text: Warning: No manure or compost sources have been added to this farm, return to the manure section and add either animals or an imported material before adding manure applications to a field.

Name: NoNutrientAnalysisAddedWarning
Text: Warning: To add manure applications to a field, the calculator requires some information about the kind of manure being applied.  Complete the information on the nutrient analysis screen for each source of manure.

Name: DailyFeedWarning
Text: The daily feed requirements used to estimate nutrients added in seasonal feeding area from feeds. Medium(2.6%) is appropriate for XX animals
